name: the seagull game (Abrigo)
description:
"As a wizard seagull, it's good that your favorite hobby consists on cleaning our ocean from the human's waste. Sing the melodies from your scroll (given to all wizard apprentices on this year's second lecture, you shouldn't have lost it) by pressing the arrow keys or the A, S and D keys to summon the Ocean Cleaning spell, (You can find out more about it on your textbook in case you didn't pay attention during class) and get rid of the garbage. Also, don't get discouraged if you keep messing up the spells, you can always try again. I'm saying this because we've noticed that most novice wizards usually lack self-confidence, get discouraged quickly and can not keep singing if their confidence bar gets depleted.

So, that's all from me. Take care, and do to the best of your ability. "

The back of the letter is empty.

Controls

Press the notes when they get close to the white bar.

  • Left Arrow/A: Circle
  • Down Arrow/S: Triangle
  • Right Arrow/D: Square
Credits

Art, (some of the) code and (most of the) music by me. Abrigo.

From Youtube:
  • samsface for the source of code of a rythm game with midi
  • Jon Topielski  for the source code with the transitions and pixel font
  • Lucas Wills for the rude buster midi

Rude Buster by Toby Fox,

Some sound effects from the Scratch's sound library,

and YOU.

...what. You think he doesn't look like a seagull? He looks more like a duck? No, probably it's just your imagination.
